I liked this course, this was my first introduction to React, I come from an Angular background, and it was easy for me to follow along the React part.

results.content: Nice mid-lenght course, energetic instructor and to the point explanations. The practical examples/projects really help in understanding how the redux pieces fit together. Highly recommended for anyone struggling with first steps in redux, although some practical react knowledge is a must to be on the same page while tackling redux in this course.
results.content_html: Nice mid-lenght course, energetic instructor and to the point explanations. The practical examples/projects really help in understanding how the redux pieces fit together. Highly recommended for anyone struggling with first steps in redux, although some practical react knowledge is a must to be on the same page while tackling redux in this course.

results.content: Great course. Learned a lot and brings in React Router and Thunk Middleware. My only ding would be that David must be accidentally modifying state directly in some of his reducers (whereas it should be a pure function and create a copy of state)

results.content: Good for beginners who are looking for redux courses. Although there's clarity in everything we do with this, we are lacking the way of mastering the redux where we actually efficiently interact with the redux app state, by making state changes. At least one advanced redux project should have been included.
results.content_html: Good for beginners who are looking for redux courses. Although there's clarity in everything we do with this, we are lacking the way of mastering the redux where we actually efficiently interact with the redux app state, by making state changes. At least one advanced redux project should have been included.

results.content: This is the fourth course I have taken from David, and as always it was awesome. I have been developing for over a year now and was a little twisted on using redux thunk. I had already taken a React course from Dave a few months ago, so figured I would check out this redux course. Amazing, solidified what I knew about redux, taught me a few new things, and low and behold the last project (meme generator) used redux thunk. YESSSS!!!!! Would give 10 stars if I could. Pleaseeeee David make a Node.js, or even better, REACT/Redux/Node.js course. Pleaseeeeee!!!!!
results.content_html: This is the fourth course I have taken from David, and as always it was awesome. I have been developing for over a year now and was a little twisted on using redux thunk. I had already taken a React course from Dave a few months ago, so figured I would check out this redux course. Amazing, solidified what I knew about redux, taught me a few new things, and low and behold the last project (meme generator) used redux thunk. YESSSS!!!!! Would give 10 stars if I could. Pleaseeeee David make a Node.js, or even better, REACT/Redux/Node.js course. Pleaseeeeee!!!!!

results.content: Good course, but I feel that last project was kind of rushed. It could use some more explanations about how middleware and async in redux works.

results.content: it was more of coding and was easy while we following the lecture. However as we progress It was very difficult to recollect those concepts.  I would expect to understand the whole project flow at the end like what we did and why we using those things like ADD, Remove etc

results.content: El chico tiene una pronunciación bastante clara y fluida, sus diapositivas están muy bien estructuradas y su tono vocal no hace que los vídeos sean aburridos, aparte de ser cortos.

results.content: This is a great course for those who already have some familiarity with React and Redux and want some code examples to reinforce the concepts. The course is probably too fast-paced for absolute beginners though.
results.content_html: This is a great course for those who already have some familiarity with React and Redux and want some code examples to reinforce the concepts. The course is probably too fast-paced for absolute beginners though.

results.content: This is a great first course when you are getting serious about Redux
results.content_html: This is a great first course when you are getting serious about Redux

results.content: This feels like an overwhelming amount of information for a beginner like myself.  However, I do believe once I understand all of this I will be able to begin programming on a much higher level.
results.content_html: This feels like an overwhelming amount of information for a beginner like myself. However, I do believe once I understand all of this I will be able to begin programming on a much higher level.

results.content: Since the course is 3 years old, there will be some issues you'll run into with the Redux applications. I've tried to troubleshoot some of the issues myself but it seems like it could boil down to something as simple as problems with outdated libraries. Despite this, the course is very informative and useful for practicing building basic React Redux applications.
results.content_html: Since the course is 3 years old, there will be some issues you'll run into with the Redux applications. I've tried to troubleshoot some of the issues myself but it seems like it could boil down to something as simple as problems with outdated libraries. Despite this, the course is very informative and useful for practicing building basic React Redux applications.

results.content: The course advanced at good pace, and the instructor knows how to explain how things work.
results.content_html: The course advanced at good pace, and the instructor knows how to explain how things work.

results.content: I had the hardest time understanding react from javascript but the instructor is very good at showing you the steps on how to setup the work environment as well as explaining why we do each step. I would say he speaks a little bit too fast for me to catch some things but that's what the rewind button is for. I'm excited to continue onto each lesson!

I would say he speaks a little bit too fast for me to catch some things but that's what the rewind button is for. I'm excited to continue onto each lesson!
